name: Camel Dive Club & Hotel

reviews.text: The room was shabby and needed painting. The air conditioning was noisy and dripping water. The bathroom shower broke, although they did fix it. There were bare wires in my room. The dive sites were busy and uninteresting. After 2 days diving, and 6 hours after lunching on their boat I developed a terrible case of food poisoning which lasted a week. I spoke to their operations manager who was disinterested and said everybody who came to Egypt became ill. Best of luck.
reviews.title: Shabby, Poor Value, Poor Diving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say, once again we had a wonderful time with all the friends we have made (staff and guests) over the years and on our many return visits to camel.
reviews.title: Camel Hotel & Dive Centre -The best Sharm has to offer

reviews.text: The hotel and dive centre are well run, clean, professional and very friendly. The onsite bars and restaurants are very good. The hotel is well situated in the middle of Naama bay. You can stay there for a family holiday, but it is predominately a hotel used by divers, so the bigger all inclusive hotels may be your thing if bringing the family and you are not divers. If you are a going solo, you will not feel lonely. Everyone is so friendly, you arrive as a customer but leave as a friend. And trust me, once you have been to camel once, you will return, it gets under your skin.
reviews.title: Need more buttons to press to go higher than "Excellent"!

reviews.text: We always feel special and looked after by the hotel and dive centre staff.
reviews.title: Great hotel for diving or quiet holidays by the pool

reviews.text: We have such a laugh and the diving is a new experience every time and totally amazing.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Perfect Dive Center

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here for a week, in which time I did my Advanced Open Water and Enriched Air Speciality and we both did some guided dives. The staff at Camel are absolutely fantastic. Very professional with incredibly high standards of instructors and a very friendly bunch. Really feel like I got a lot from my week here :0). The hotel is located right in the centre of Na'ama bay close to all the shops and restaurants and has 2 private beaches of its own as well as a pool area. The whole hotel is spotlessly clean and plenty of staff around to make sure things run smoothly. Rooms are spacious and clean with room safes, mini bar, plenty of wardrobe space etc. Food in all the associated restaurants, cafes etc that are owned by Camel was delicious and fresh, no tummy complaints here! The bar is great and a wonderful place to unwind and swap dive stories. Loved my time here and wouldn't hesitate to recommend.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic dive centre, highly recommend
Outstanding Dive Center & Staff *****
reviews.text: Although we never stayed at the hotel I would just like to say what a great 2 days diving my wife and i had with you. We had our dives on the 26th & 27th Jan. It was our first time diving the Red Sea, and first ever boat dives. I must say what a great experience we had, the diving was out of this world and the best we have ever done. Saw my first White tip reef shark and eagle ray just to mention a few of the outstanding fish you have out there. But most of all the thing that made our diving great was the dive guide Alexander Hager, what a great guy very helpful, explained everything thoroughly and always cheerful. The boat crew of the Sehss where great to, always there to lend a hand and nothing seemed to much for them. They made our time onboard very comfortable and the food was probably the best we had out there. Cant wait to see you all again soon.

reviews.title: New Year Holiday in the Sun!
reviews.text: Toby & Katrina

reviews.title: Diving with Camel
reviews.text: A fantastic place to stay. As we were in Sharm to Dive this was an ideal place to stay. Rooms were large and comfortable and clean. Staff at Hotel and Dive Club were fantastic and would do anything to assist. Rates for rooms if combined with diving are excellent. Nice to stay with other like minded people as well and all restaurants are close and there is plenty to choose from.

reviews.title: Good hotel for divers
reviews.text: Sooo good heading back there shortly! Love it, love the people, the atmosphere, the food, the scenery, the Sakara beer, and of course the diving!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from a 2 week stay in the Red Sea and whilst I didn't stay at the Camel Hotel, I did use their facilities. The Dive centre is very well run by enthusiartic and well qualified staff. I wanted to do a couple of deep tech dives whilst I was there and Camel were able to accomodate this easily, there approach was very professional and yet relaxed. I can't recommend them enough, and the Camel Bar!!!! well there is no better place in Naama Bay for an end of dive beer.
reviews.title: Camel Dive Club - Excellent Dive center

reviews.text: Spent a couple of weeks at the Camel Hotel in September with the Camel Dive Club doing my Divemaster training.
reviews.title: Satisfied Divemaster Trainee (who passed !)........

reviews.text: As a Divemaster Trainee you get a behind the scenes look at all aspects of the dive centre and I am pleased to pass on that Camel Dive Club is a professional, well run set up with an emphasis on diver safety and client satisfaction. For my DMT I was assigned a personal instructor (who was just excellent) for the whole time and she focused on my diving skills (the good and the bad!) and really helped me to improve every aspect of my diving and dive knowledge (plenty of exams for DMTs!). Despite the hard work, there was plenty of diving and opportunities to improve skills and guiding (under supervision of both my primary instructor as well as other who provided complementary points of view). The dive sights were varied and particular care was taken to try and accommodate clients so that there were a wide variety of dive sites experienced each week.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel with big facilities.

reviews.text: As for diving in Sharm, it really is spectacular. My particular favourite sites were down around Ras Mohammed National Park which was akin to diving in a Cousteau documentary.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in the hotel in a twin room on my own. It was nicely appointed, very clean, well air conditioned and quiet (even in the centre of Naama bay!). The pool was used for guests and for diver training (great location for new diver training) and was a great place to take a dip at the beginning of each day to wake up before breakfast and head out for dives. On the subject of breakfast, excellent buffet with all you could ask for (omelettes etc. available as well). Very friendly staff who were happy to organise transfers, pick ups, taxi etc. If you haven’t been to Sharm before, I would recommend booking a pick up through Camel as it made my life a lot easier at the airport as I was guided through the immigration procedure and taken straight to the hotel. I would comment that this is a dive centre hotel, so if you are not a diver / snorkeller you may feel a bit out of place, however, it is right in the centre of town if location is what you are after.
reviews.title: Camel Dive

reviews.text: I have now been to Camel 8 times, so I think it is fair to say that I like it there!
reviews.title: Diving excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and comfortable and there is a nice pool area to chill out in when you are not diving. The on site Indian and Italian restaurants are excellent and the Camel roof bar is an institute in itself!
reviews.title: Amazing place

reviews.text: Now to the real reason I go back so often - the diving! Dive guides are world class in my opinion. I have travelled to many places and the Camel staff stand out in their professional and friendly approach. Guides are incredibly knowledgeable about the dive sites and marine life and their enthusiasm shows. My latest visit in June 2013 presented some mind blowing dives around Ras Mohammed with literally hundreds of fish shoaling. The guides make sure you get the best out of your trip.
reviews.title: As always a awesome holiday

reviews.text: Obviously can't finish without mentioning the fabulous boat crew and dive operation staff from the counter to the kit room and on board the boat, they are all excellent. You will be very well cared for. Boats are clean and spacious and the food on board is delicious.
reviews.title: Fab trip as always

reviews.text: This is an organised and well run outfit. I have been there throughout the troubles in recent years and never felt unsafe or worried. Excellent operations like this will always continue to win my repeat business.
reviews.title: Fab hotel for a diving holiday

reviews.text: It was a perfect week! Everything was great, a all in one service. Hotel, Restaurant, Bar and Dive Center. We had to organize nothing, it was really enjoyable and relaxing. Great Diving in the Red Sea. We went to the Thistlegorm, Dahab, Street of Tiran, Ras Mohammed and the Dunraven. It was all perfectly organized. I will come back once!
reviews.title: Great Dive Club and Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in camel diving hotel last week. I really liked it. They have a professionel diving team,they are very helpfull. especially "deniz", we liked you too much. She's excellent for turkish divers,bacause she is the only guide who can speak turkish in sharm i think. The hotel is in the midlle of naama bay ,this is good actually but too much noisy nights till morning.rooms are good but the beaulding is a little old and sometimes technical problems especially in the bathroom occurs, but not a big deal. The personel is kind,they are helpfull. So we spend a good week there and i suggest camel diving hotel everyone...
reviews.title: Very good,espacially for diving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel for diving. The dive centre is fantastic. The instructors are helpful and professional, all the dive trips and equipment are professionally organised. The staff and crew are polite and helpful. We had a chance to improve our diving and met very nice people along the way, without stressing about planning or organising dives, but just by paying!
reviews.title: Diving

reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice, good, clean rooms. Our first room was facing the street so very noisy but the next night we were given a room facing the pool so it was nice and peaceful. Breakfast was generous.
reviews.title: Diving with the Professionals

reviews.text: The hotel's location is great, right in the centre of action, near bars and restaurants. We liked meze at Fayrouz and Camel Bar was very popular!
reviews.title: Home for Divers

reviews.text: I stayed here last year and after returning form Sharm last week I have to say I have found a much better company to dive with this time!
reviews.title: Don't Bother! Sinai Divers is the way forward!

reviews.text: I found Camel to be well and truly "up themselves". Like they are some sort of cult or the only dive company in the world. They think they are the best and they seemed to have this if "its not you there will be another" attitude to go with it! Thats not what I want from any company that I deal with in diving or any other business. All customers are important no matter how many people you have walking through the door!
reviews.title: Wonderful dives!!

reviews.text: Camel staff seem overworked and pretty stressed most of the time! They have lots of stupid paperwork to do and don't seem to be given the time to do what they are there to do - looking after the guests! There was a horrible atmosphere in the dive centre as well and I think this has a lot to do with how the staff are treated and what they are expected to do!
reviews.title: The best place to stay in Naama

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The diving was great! Not that Camel made it great - Its great with any decent dive company in Sharm. However most of the boats that camel use are small and sometimes overcrowded. Some of them are dirty and smelly (fumes inside the cabin etc) The sea can sometimes be very rough and being on a small boats is really not what you need for a nice days diving. Also I found the crew on some of the boats moody and well lets just a bit too friendly towards the female guests at times! The food was good on some boats, but not so good on others - some boats served this pink kofta stuff that I avoided like the plague - Yuk!
reviews.title: Very poor dive clubs - they want your money and don't care for anyone's safety

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was nice and clean and the breakfast and lunch in the Pomadoro restaurant was excellent!
reviews.title: Great stay at the Camel Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed with Camel for 9 days in November 2009. We wanted to take a SCUBA course, and Camel had the best deal. After arriving it became clear they had more to offer than a good price...
reviews.title: Talk about having it all...
Dive with Camel
reviews.text: 1) Location: Na'ama bay is like a miniature Las Vegas for Egypt. Lots of lights and glitter, tons to do at all hours, many many different eating options, great cafes... Don't be scared away though, as it is SMALL, so you can find quieter areas without having to take a taxi. We took a taxi to Old Market for some shopping at slightly lower prices, but that was our only non-walking trip. Also, Camel faces a pedestrian only road with tons of little cafes and restaurants, all with huge outdoor seating areas in perfect temperatures.

2) Food: Looking for authentic Egyptian cuisine was actually difficult. Again, this is more attuned to tourism than other parts of Sharm. We ate at Little Budha (twice - expensive, beautiful, great food, sushi!), Camel's Pomodoro (not authentic Italian, but good), Camel's Tandori (twice - REALLY GOOD - oh, and they let you make your own nama bread if you want!), a Chinese resto on top of Na'ama center (main mall just 2 minutes walk from Camel) which was so/so... There is a Hard Rock and other well known restaurants, as well as a dozen places actually on the beach, in the sand, serving the FRESHEST seafood. One note - I had heard of Lido's On The Deck and we went to try it, but decided against it. The tables are over the water with the most spectacular view all around you, especially after dark, but the price was incredibly inflated and nothing on the menu was special... same options you could get down the beach for less than half the price...
reviews.title: Brilliant service at great value hotel with fab dive centre.

reviews.text: 3) Hotel: Rooms were great, good size, quiet. You might be able to hear the club late at night next door, but only if you were trying... Most people breathe louder than that when they sleep. The hotel offers free wifi in the pool area, but we were able to get it in our room too, just barely (room 203). All the rooms look into the center pool, and you'd never know you were on a lively, high-activity strip and bustling road due to the peace and quiet in the courtyard. It is well separated from the street outside! The pool is a dive pool, so for our course we didn't have to go anywhere! We woke up, had a GREAT buffet breakfast (American style, so you won't starve on a slice of cheese and a danish, but can have all kinds of fruit, eggs, omelets, etc), walked out to the pool, dove, walked to the beach, dove, back to the hotel, went to the room, showered, back down for some class work, etc. Really a nice all-in-one setup. The staff was excellent, friendly, not in the slightest way "lazy" as some have written. ON THE OTHER HAND - every time we sat at Cafe Vanilla (just in front of Camel) the service was horrible...
reviews.title: Excellent diving

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4) Shisha: We decided to try a different flavor of shisha every night. The routine became to find a nice, comfortable couch at one of the many cafes along the street, order a shisha, a cafe, and a sahlam (very creamy, milky hot drink with raisin and nuts - REALLY GOOD). Most places offered blankets if the night was cool, and often the servers were friendly and would try to teach you a few words in Arabic. This is truly a great way to relax before bed... The best cafe (I forget the name) is just in front of the Na'ama center, second to last one on the right side of the street...
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Dive Club, great diving and great food
You will go back!
reviews.text: I have now stayed here twice and am looking to go back again. I have been visiting Sharm for 10 years now, at least twice a years for both diving and family holidays and have stayed in some great hotels there. However this one for diving has the right mix of everything. The staff can not be faulted, And by day one you will be treated as close friend. Any problems are always resolved immediately and apologetically. The dive operation is so professional that all the stress is taken out it, and you just turn up and dive, brilliant. If you are travelling as a family I would try to book into the Grand Rotana which is a super 5 star hotel and has a Camel dive office on site. For diving I would recommend Camel's new speed boat trips as the boat ride alone is fantastic and most of all the day trip to Dahab to dive the blue hole is a must. Camel arrange such a perfect day it has now become a fixture on our trips. All that goes without saying that the restaurants and bar are the best in town as well. Can't wait to see Omar, Rod, Jules and Stacey (Beth) again soon!

I spent 4 nights at the CDC from 31st January 2013, I can't really fault this place, I booked transfers with the hotel and I thought it was well worth it, I was met immediately as I entered the airport in Sharm, no haggling with taxi's and I was delivered conveniently to my accommodation, check in was quick and I was shown to my room, which was on the ground floor and right next to the pool, massive kingsize bed!! which I slept beautifully in, after reading reviews and knowing the location, I was a bit worried that it would be too noisy for me at night, but they have triple glazing, so I was fine. The room was very clean, excellent shower with hot water and good water pressure, its not 5* luxury but I had absolutely no complaints & I thought it was very reasonably priced. Breakfast was very good and the coffee was very drinkable (I get very miserable if I don't have reasonable coffee to drink, I had packed my own but ended up not needing it) They don't have room service here but I ordered Pizza from the onsite Italian restaurant and it was delivered to my room! I found the service to be great and everyone I dealt with was really helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: I wasn't diving but I loved this place, already booked return visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My favourite things about the CDC are the location, its very close the beach and everything else is on the doorstep, the second thing is the size of the hotel, its really small, only 38 rooms I think, so during the day time when people are diving the pool is really quiet, you wouldn't believe that you were in the centre of Naama Bay. I'm going back!!
reviews.title: Mixed

reviews.text: My partner and I have just returned from a week at Camel. Overall we were happy with our stay. The web price was 392 euro each for B&B and 10 dives. We really could not fault the hotel staff at all - friendly and eager to please. Ehab in the restaurant was just delightful. The receptionist in the dive centre might benefit from a course in customer relations. No smile, no niceties, no hello, just a 'what's your name?'. There are no planned dives so each day we needed to check what was availalble. We really wanted to go to the Thistlegorm and Dahab. We were told we would have to wait and see if there were enough people to go on a trip. This made it difficult for us as we didn't know whether to book these 2 trips with another dive club. In the end it was all OK. The staff are only paid when they take divers out so there was competition with guides trying to get business for their trips... not terribly professional. The guides we had were all great but Sven was particularly good at ensuring everyone was safe. Boat staff were absolutely brilliant and the food they provided was wonderful. One day I was unwell and didn't dive, however I accompanied my partner on the boat. I was charged 38 euro for the pleasure. If I had done my 2 dives I would have been charged 40 euro! Thistlegorm is a must. It was a real experience - even if it was a bit scary. Definitely only for very experienced divers. I have never experienced a current like that. Ratios on dives not great - Dahab was one guide to 9 divers. but then that's why you pay 20 euros a dive! Bit of a shock when we came to pay the bill. The extras were nearly 500 euros on top of the 400 so not as cheap as we first thought. Can't complain about the room in the hotel, it had everything we needed and we were only woken one night by music. If you have the air con on you can't hear anything. Good location and would consider returning.
reviews.title: SPECIAL OFFERS

reviews.text: I have dived with the dive club many times, but stayed in hotel once. The diving is recommend to any level of diver! This aspect is highly recommended, as they are friendly, professional and create a enjoyable atmosphere!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: great hotel for the money, shame about the loud noise nearby

aka: Camel Dive Club Hotel Sharm El Sheikh
